title: Crime victim table - regression to the mean

content.description:
A social psychologist conducted a study to examine the effect of the availability heuristic on judgment. The psychologist recruited 20 participants for the study and assigned them to one of two groups. 
The participants completed a survey. One survey question asked participants to rate the likelihood that they would become the victim of a crime. Participants in Group A read a series of news reports about crime-related incidents and then completed the survey. The participants in Group B completed the survey without exposure to the news reports.
The table presents the mean ratings by participants of how likely they thought they would be to become the victim of a crime, divided by group.

content.question: As more participants provide their ratings, which of the following results could the psychologist expect to find?

choices.label: The mean ratings for Group A will decrease and the mean ratings for Group B will increase.
Group A participants will become less susceptible to social desirability effects.
The participants will become less representative of the larger population.

content.answer: The mean ratings for Group A will decrease and the mean ratings for Group B will increase.
